unnormalised: Guys, Delhi traffic's gonna get a whole lot stricter! New traffic regulations are rolling out next month, so buckle up (literally!). Dr. Mehra from the Transport Ministry announced heavier fines for everything from signal jumping to not wearing helmets.
normalised: Guys, Delhi traffic's going to get a whole lot stricter! New traffic regulations are rolling out next month, so buckle up (literally!). Doctor Mehra from the Transport Ministry announced heavier fines for everything from signal jumping to not wearing helmets.

unnormalised: Think double the current rates, folks! We're talking potentially hefty Rs. 5000 for repeated offenses. They're also cracking down on illegal parking – that shortcut you take near Sarojini Nagar market? Forget about it! Your car could get towed, and you'll be singing the 'parking challan' blues.
normalised: Think double the current rates, folks! We're talking potentially hefty rupee five thousand for repeated offenses. They're also cracking down on illegal parking – that shortcut you take near Sarojini Nagar market? Forget about it! Your car could get towed, and you'll be singing the 'parking challan' blues.

unnormalised: The goal? Less chaos, more order. Apparently, studies show traffic accidents contribute significantly to air pollution due to idling engines. So, obeying the rules isn't just about your wallet; it's about breathing easier too.
normalised: The goal? Less chaos, more order. Apparently, studies show traffic accidents contribute significantly to air pollution due to idling engines. So, obeying the rules isn't just about your wallet; it's about breathing easier too.

unnormalised: Plus, authorities are investing in new CCTV cameras with AI-powered number plate recognition. No hiding from the law anymore, bhai! They're also expanding parking spaces, planning for multi-level parking solutions in crowded areas covering thousands of sq ft. So get ready for the changes, and drive safe! Jai Hind!
normalised: Plus, authorities are investing in new C C T V cameras with A I powered number plate recognition. No hiding from the law anymore, bhai! They're also expanding parking spaces, planning for multi-level parking solutions in crowded areas covering thousands of square feet. So get ready for the changes, and drive safe! Jai Hind!
